name: Bermuda Triangle
description: Mysterious disappearances and time slip reports.

name: Stonehenge
description: Believed to be a cosmic calendar or portal.

name: Hafele–Keating Experiment
description: Time measured differently aboard flying atomic clocks.

name: CERN - Large Hadron Collider
description: The world's most powerful particle collider — some believe it's bending the fabric of space-time itself.

name: Devil’s Triangle
description: The Pacific cousin of the Bermuda Triangle — known for vanishing ships and time anomalies in local legends.

name: Sedona Vortex
description: A spiritual hotspot said to distort time and perception. Visitors report lost time, altered awareness, and energy fields.

name: Mount Roraima
description: A flat-topped mountain shrouded in cloud and lore. Locals say time passes differently at the summit.
timeEffect: Perceived time dilation; reports of losing track of days

name: The Chrono Canyon
description: A fictional yet persistent legend among hikers who claim hours vanish in this strange crevice in the desert.
timeEffect: Time slips, memory loss, and unaccounted gaps

name: Green Bank Radio Quiet Zone
description: Electromagnetic silence surrounds this scientific zone. GPS and timing devices behave erratically here.

name: Anjikuni Village Vanishing
description: A mysterious 1930s case where an entire Inuit village disappeared. Rumors include time anomalies.

name: Kola Superdeep Borehole
description: The deepest human-made hole. Seismic and electromagnetic data suggest unusual temporal resonance.

name: Dyatlov Pass Incident
description: 1959 event where 9 hikers died under strange conditions. Some theorists believe time distortion played a role.
timeEffect: Disorientation, fast decay rates, trauma without apparent cause
